content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the obvious edge. From there, work straight out the overhang to a set of good edges (crux), then either make a big move to a high edge, or work the smaller intermediate holds to reach a juggy topout just right of the juniper tree.
content.protection: A pad should do it, the landing is flat and clear.
content.location: It ascends the far west portion of the southwest overhang on Thalassic Boulder.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand jug and a right hand sidepull. From there, make a big move out right to another jug, then finish straight up using the remaining edges.
content.protection: A pad will suffice, the landing is perfect.
content.location: It ascends the center-left of Thalassic's southwest overhang.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand edge and a big right hand sidepull. From there, trend slightly left to a pair of decent edges. Then obtain a pair of small crimps and make a move leap to the lip (crux), and top it out.
content.protection: A pad will work fine, the landing doesn't get much better.
content.location: It ascends the far right overhanging face of Thalassic's southwest face.

content.description: Stand start with hands matched on small diagonal edge. From there, make a quick move to the good edge just above it (crux?), then work up to another pair of edges, spring a high left heel around the overhang (crux?), and finish up the remaining jugs to top it out.
content.protection: A pad will do, the landing is very good.
content.location: It ascends the center of Thalassic's southwest face.
